text: Dynamic class field creation before metaclass machinery
I'm trying to get rid of exec in a code similar to this:

code:
class A(object):
    for field in ['one', 'two', 'three']:
        exec '%s = "%s value"' % (field, field)

>>> A.one
'one value'
>>> A.two
'two value'
>>> A.three
'three value'

text: EDIT: and also the requirement mentioned in the subject is met i.e.
A.one is 'one value', before A is instantiated (not to be mistaken for A() instantiated).
